pageContext.claim: “Cyrus the Great, a leader of the ancient Persian Empire, famously said that '[f]reedom, dignity, and wealth together constitute the greatest happiness of humanity. If you bequeath all three to your people, their love for you will never die.'”
pageContext.analysis: In his statement to Iranians on the Nowruz holiday, Trump cited a supposed quote from Cyrus the Great, the founder of the Achaemenid Empire, which stretched from the Balkans to South Asia at its height. But Mic reported that experts and historians who study the Achaemenids say this is a bogus Cyrus quote. It apparently came from a 2006 book on leadership advice that places high in Google results.
